intro: Chaerophyllum hirsutum subsp. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy chaerophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbel-like clusters. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and garden cultivation.
